Name: Aberration Kinship
Benefits: Your mind resonates with the inscrutable thought processes that inhuman aberrations use to communicate.

Name: Acrobatic Performer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Use Acrobatics to Perform.

Name: Acute Vision
Benefits: Your sense improve when you are raging.

Name: Adapted Cantrip
Benefits: Through study of multiple magical traditions, you’ve altered a spell to suit your spellcasting style.

Name: Additional Lore
Benefits: Become trained in another Lore subcategory.

Name: Adhyabhau
Benefits: You descend from the rare psychic vampires known as vetalaranas.

Name: Adopted Ancestry
Benefits: Gain access to ancestry feats from another ancestry.

Name: Adrenaline Rush
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: In the heat of battle, you are capable of amazing feats of strength.

Name: Adroit Manipulation
Benefits: You’ve fiddled with knots, locks, and blacksmith’s puzzles since you were a child to give your hands something to do.

Name: Advanced Weaponry
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon's attack evolves.

Name: Ageless Spirit
Benefits: You remember more about your previous incarnations than most leshys.

Name: Alchemical Crafting
Benefits: Craft alchemical items.

Name: Alchemical Familiar
Benefits: You have used alchemy to create life, a simple creature formed from alchemical materials, reagents, and a bit of your own blood.

Name: Alchemical Savant
Benefits: You can identify alchemical items quickly.

Name: Alchemical Scholar
Benefits: You learn formulas more easily.

Name: Alghollthu Bound
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: Although you may not even be aware, the alghollthus your ancestors once served maintain a stranglehold on the deepest, tethered parts of your mind.

Name: Anadi Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You've learned how to provide for your community, be it through hard-earned sustenance or useful crafts.

Name: Ancestral Blood Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The magic of your bloodline mixes with that of your ancestry.

Name: Ancestral Insight
Benefits: You have extensive knowledge of your ancestors' ancient origins.

Name: Ancestral Linguistics
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Over your extensive lifespan, you've studied many languages.

Name: Ancestral Longevity
Benefits: You have accumulated a vast array of lived knowledge over the years.

Name: Android Lore
Benefits: You have a keen interest in the origins of your people.

Name: Angelkin
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You descend from an angel—a winged messenger from Nirvana or one of the other celestial realms—which gives you a knack for cultures and languages.

Name: Animal Accomplice
Benefits: You build a rapport with an animal, which becomes magically bonded to you.

Name: Animal Companion
Benefits: You gain the service of a young animal companion that travels with you.

Name: Animal Senses
Benefits: You gain one of the following senses available to your inherent animal: darkvision, low-light vision, or scent (imprecise) 30 feet.

Name: Aquatic Eyes
Benefits: As your connection to water grows, you can see more easily in places with less light, such as the depths of the ocean.

Name: Arcane Fists
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your physical training encompasses unarmed combat forms.

Name: Arcane Sense
Benefits: Cast detect magic at will as an arcane innate spell.

Name: Arcane Tattoos
Benefits: You have tattoos on your body corresponding to one of the ancient Thassilonian schools of magic.

Name: Armor Assist
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Athletics or Warfare Lore
Benefits: Don armor more quickly.

Name: Armor Proficiency
Benefits: Become trained in a type of armor.

Name: Assurance
Prerequisites: trained in at least one skill
Benefits: Receive a fixed result on a skill check.

Name: Avenge in Glory
Benefits: You honor your ally’s life, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute.

Name: Axiomatic Lore
Benefits: You possess a strong understanding of process among mortals and lawful outsiders alike.

Name: Azarketi Lore
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You have learned the history and origins of your people and how to connect to both your land and sea heritage.

Name: Azarketi Weapon Familiarity
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You are familiar with weapons that excel underwater.

Name: Bardic Lore
Benefits: Your studies make you informed on every subject.

Name: Bargain Hunter
Benefits: Earn Income by searching for deals.

Name: Battle Medicine
Benefits: Heal yourself or an ally in battle.

Name: Beast Trainer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have an impressive innate ability to tame and command ferocious beasts.

Name: Beastbrood
Benefits: One of your ancestors was a rakshasa, the corrupt and aristocratic reincarnated souls that call Golarion home.

Name: Blessed Blood
Prerequisites: bloodline that grants divine spells; you follow a deity
Benefits: Your deity’s blessings manifest in your blood-borne power

Name: Bon Mot
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Distract a foe with a witty quip.

Name: Bone Magic
Benefits: Your connection to your iruxi ancestors manifests as a simple primal spell that you cast using a fragment of an ancestor's bones.

Name: Bouncy Goblin
Benefits: You have a particular elasticity that makes it easy for you to bounce and squish.

Name: Breath Control
Benefits: Hold your breath longer and gain benefits against inhaled threats.

Name: Brightsoul
Benefits: The fire inside you asserts itself as beaming, radiant light.

Name: Brine May
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your mother was a sea hag, granting you one sea-green or blue eye.

Name: Brinesoul
Benefits: Your elemental ancestor's legacy asserts itself as brackish water, like the seawater of the ocean.

Name: Buckler Expertise
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned a flexible way to position your buckler to provide more protection.

Name: Burn It!
Benefits: Fire fascinates you.

Name: Burrow Elocutionist
Benefits: You recognize the chittering of ground creatures as its own peculiar language.

Name: Cackle
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can extend one of your spells with a quick burst of laughter.

Name: Callow May
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are among the most common of changelings—those born to green hags—and a vibrant green eye signifies that parentage.

Name: Canny Acumen
Benefits: Become an expert in a saving throw or Perception.

Name: Cantorian Reinforcement
Benefits: The life energy that helped create the first hobgoblins is particularly potent in you, protecting you from ongoing maladies.

Name: Cat Fall
Benefits: Treat falls as shorter than they are.

Name: Cat Nap
Benefits: You can briefly sleep to regain your energy quickly.

Name: Catch the Details
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You are quick at recognizing broad details about people and things around you.

Name: Catfolk Dance
Benefits: You have a habit of always being in the way when other creatures attempt to move.

Name: Catfolk Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Growing up among catfolk has taught you the traditional values of freedom to travel, stewardship of the land, and quick reactions when your curiosity lands you in trouble.

Name: Catfolk Weapon Familiarity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You favor weapons that you can use with quick, darting slashes like a cat's claws.

Name: Cat's Luck
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You instinctively twist away from danger.

Name: Cauldron
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can use the Craft activity to create oils and potions.

Name: Cel Rau
Benefits: You are a cel rau, child of a strigoi, one of the first vampires to walk Golarion.

Name: Celestial Eyes
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can see through darkness.

Name: Celestial Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You were raised with an aasimar or celestial relative, or you've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the celestial realms.

Name: Ceremony of Protection
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You manipulate your exoskeleton to overlap itself.

Name: Ceremony of the Evened Hand
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have cultivated your exoskeleton's form for close combat, using knots, whorls, and reinforced branches.

Name: Chance Death
Benefits: Your previous life ended due to sheer poor luck, struck by lightning or choking on a fish bone.

Name: Changeling Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: All too aware of your true nature, you’ve studied hags and their powers.

Name: Charlatan
Benefits: You’ve learned to mimic the abilities of spellcasters by studying their flourishes and words

Name: Charming Liar
Benefits: Improve a target's attitude with your lies.

Name: Cheek Pouches
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your cheeks are stretchy, and you can store up to four items of light Bulk or less in these cheek pouches.

Name: Cindersoul
Benefits: The fire of your elemental ancestor manifests like dying embers of a blaze, and your inner charcoal helps staunch bleeding, purify simple poisons, and absorb acid.

Name: City Scavenger
Benefits: You know that the greatest treasures often look like refuse, and you scoff at those who throw away perfectly good scraps.

Name: Clan's Edge
Benefits: By moving your clan dagger with rapid precision, you can protect yourself more effectively.

Name: Cleansing Subroutine
Benefits: Your nanites help purge your body of harmful chemicals and toxins.

Name: Combat Assessment
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You make a telegraphed attack to learn about your foe.

Name: Combat Climber
Benefits: Fight more effectively as you Climb.

Name: Concealing Legerdemain
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Conceal an Object using Thievery instead of Stealth.

Name: Conrasu Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have learned about your history and your people from shapers.

Name: Conrasu Weapon Familiarity
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have taken it upon yourself to learn the ways of combat to aid with your tasks, perhaps in a role as a corrector.

Name: Consult the Stars
Benefits: You find wisdom in the movements of the heavens.

Name: Cooperative Nature
Benefits: The short human life span lends perspective and has taught you from a young age to set aside differences and work with others to achieve greatness.

Name: Corgi Mount
Benefits: The smallest of fey have ridden corgis as mounts since time immemorial, leading to a pattern on corgis' backs called a “faerie saddle.

Name: Counterspell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When a foe Casts a Spell and you can see its manifestations, you can use your own magic to disrupt it.

Name: Courteous Comeback
Benefits: You grew up in the proud Padishah Empire, where even insults have a certain poetic wit.

Name: Courtly Graces
Benefits: Use Society to get along in noble society.

Name: Crafter's Appraisal
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Use Crafting to identify magic items.

Name: Crane Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of a crane, holding your arms in an imitation of a crane’s wings.

Name: Creative Prodigy
Benefits: You have a powerful creative drive, useful for prevarication and performance.

Name: Cringe
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With pitiful posturing, you cause your foe to pull back a deadly attack.

Name: Critter Shape
Benefits: Once per hour, you can use Change Shape to enter a critter shape.

Name: Crossbow Ace
Benefits: You have a deep understanding of the crossbow.

Name: Crunch
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your jaws can crush bone and bite through armor.

Name: Cynical
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You've been approached with suspicion and distrust throughout your life and return these sentiments back to the strangers you encounter.

Name: Dangerous Sorcery
Benefits: Your legacy grants you great destructive power.

Name: Deadly Simplicity
Prerequisites: deity with a simple or unarmed attack favored weapon, trained with your deity's favored weapon
Benefits: Your deity’s weapon is especially powerful in your hands.

Name: Deceptive Worship
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Pass yourself off as a member of a religion.

Name: Deepvision
Benefits: Your vision is suited for night or the underground.

Name: Deity's Domain
Benefits: You embody an aspect of your deity.

Name: Deliberate Death
Benefits: Once, you died because someone—murderer or monster, soldier or executioner— chose to strike you down.

Name: Demonbane Warrior
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to damage with weapons and unarmed attacks against demons.

Name: Desperate Prayer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You call out to your deity in a plea for their aid.

Name: Devil's Advocate
Benefits: You know more about the habits of devils than is entirely safe.

Name: Diehard
Benefits: Die at dying 5, rather than dying 4.

Name: Different Worlds
Prerequisites: ability to select ancestry feats from multiple ancestries
Benefits: Create a second identity for yourself with a different name, history, and background.

Name: Dig Quickly
Benefits: Your hands work as effectively as shovels when you need to dig a quick hole.

Name: Disarming Flair
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: It's harder for your foes to regain their grip when you knock their weapon partially out of their hands.

Name: Distracting Shadows
Benefits: You have learned to remain hidden by using larger folk as a distraction to avoid drawing attention to yourself.

Name: Domain Initiate
Benefits: Your deity bestows a special spell related to their powers.

Name: Double Slice
Benefits: You lash out at your foe with both weapons.

Name: Draconic Arrogance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Few can sway you from your goals while the fury of combat fills you.

Name: Draconic Sycophant
Benefits: You have an affect that dragonkind find unusually pleasing—and when that fails, you know when to duck.

Name: Dragon Spit
Benefits: Many Tian-Dan claim to have dragon blood in their veins, and in your case, this is true—you can spit energy, and you might have an especially visible sign of your draconic heritage.

Name: Dragon Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon’s tail.

Name: Dragon's Presence
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As a member of dragonkind, you project unflappable confidence

Name: Dream May
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are the child of a night hag, making one of your eyes violet or even black.

Name: Dual Studies
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You and your eidolon have some skills you practice on your own.

Name: Dualborn
Benefits: Your suli heritage can be traced back to two geniekin ancestors of opposing elements, or to an elemental ancestor that embodied two combined elements.

Name: Dubious Knowledge
Prerequisites: trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action
Benefits: Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check.

Name: Dueling Parry (Swashbuckler)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can parry attacks against you with your weapon.

Name: Duskwalker Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You either found another duskwalker who taught you the secrets of your kind, or you managed to research your unusual heritage.

Name: Dustsoul
Benefits: Your earth elemental ancestor's influence manifests in you as dust and dirt, like the soil of a field or the hot desert sands.

Name: Dwarven Doughtiness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are either naturally calm and collected in the face of imminent danger, or you are very good at faking it.

Name: Dwarven Lore
Benefits: You eagerly absorbed the old stories and traditions of your ancestors, your gods, and your people.

Name: Dwarven Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: Your kin have instilled in you an affinity for hard-hitting weapons, and you prefer these to more elegant arms.

Name: Earned Glory
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Elves are often skeptical of their half-elven kin, and you are experienced at telling stories of your accomplishments to gain their respect.

Name: Eidetic Ear
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You have an amazing memory for sound.

Name: Elemental Assault
Benefits: You shroud your arms and held weapons in elemental magic.

Name: Elemental Embellish
Benefits: You can summon a harmless but impressive elemental display.

Name: Elemental Eyes
Benefits: You can see in the darkness as easily as an elemental.

Name: Elemental Lore
Benefits: You've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the Inner Sphere.

Name: Elemental Trade
Benefits: You have a strong connection with stone and metal.

Name: Elemental Wrath
Benefits: You are so attuned to the land that you can call forth a bolt of energy from your surroundings.

Name: Elf Atavism
Benefits: Your elven blood runs particularly strong, granting you features far more elven than those of a typical half-elf.

Name: Elven Aloofness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: As much as you might care for them, you've come to terms with the ephemeral nature of non-elves, and it makes their threats feel less troublesome.

Name: Elven Lore
Benefits: You’ve studied in traditional elven arts, learning about arcane magic and the world around you.

Name: Elven Verve
Benefits: While all elves are immune to the paralyzing touch of ghouls, you can shake off flesh-numbing magic of all kinds.

Name: Elven Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You favor bows and other elegant weapons.

Name: Emberkin
Benefits: A peri's roaring spirit burns in your soul.

Name: Ember's Eyes
Benefits: Your eyes blaze with inner flame.

Name: Emotionless
Benefits: Your malfunctioning emotional processors make it difficult for you to feel strong emotions.

Name: Empathetic Plea
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The way you cringe or use those puppydog eyes you've been practicing elicits an empathetic response in the attacker.

Name: Energy Heart
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon's heart beats with energy.

Name: Eschew Materials
Benefits: You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials.

Name: Esteemed Visitor
Benefits: Your polite manners and natural ability to comfort others make it easy for you to break down cultural barriers and earn strangers’ trust.

Name: Evanescent Wings
Benefits: You've manifested wings that can flutter for brief spurts.

Name: Everstand Stance
Benefits: You brace your shield with both hands, enhancing its potential for both offense and defense.

Name: Exacting Strike
Benefits: You make a controlled attack, fully accounting for your momentum.

Name: Expanded Senses
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon evolves more acute senses.

Name: Experienced Professional
Benefits: Prevent critical failures when Earning Income.

Name: Experienced Smuggler
Benefits: Conceal items from observers more effectively.

Name: Experienced Tracker
Benefits: Track at your full Speed at a –5 penalty.

Name: Express Rider
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Increase your mount’s travel speed.

Name: Extend Boost
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You can increase the duration of your eidolon's boosts.

Name: Extra Squishy
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your rubbery physique makes it easier for you to wedge yourself into tight spaces and more difficult for your enemies to dislodge you.

Name: Eye for Numbers
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: +2 to Decipher Writing about math and count items quickly.

Name: Eye for Treasure
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You know good artisanship when you see it and can wax poetic about crafting techniques and forms.

Name: Eyes of the Night
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can see in the darkness as easily as a true vampire.

Name: False Faith
Source: Pathfinder #148
Benefits: Droskar knows you may need to disguise yourself in societies that oppose your faith.

Name: Familiar
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: An animal serves you and assists your spellcasting.

Name: Fang Sharpener
Prerequisites: Irongut Goblin heritage or Razortooth Goblin heritage
Benefits: You have filed your teeth into jagged points and have an unusually powerful jaw, making your mouth a dangerous weapon.

Name: Fangs
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your incisors have grown into true fangs: long, sharp, and well-suited to drawing blood.

Name: Far Lobber
Benefits: You’ve learned how to throw a longer distance.

Name: Fascinating Performance
Benefits: Perform to fascinate observers.

Name: Fast Recovery
Benefits: Regain more HP from rest, recover faster from disease and poisons.

Name: Feather Step
Benefits: Step into difficult terrain.

Name: Fetchling Lore
Benefits: You've learned obscure lessons about your fellow fetchlings.

Name: Fey Cantrips
Benefits: You've learned the cantrips sprites have used since time immemorial.

Name: Fey Fellowship
Benefits: Your enhanced fey connection affords you a warmer reception from creatures of the First World.

Name: Fiendish Eyes
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can see in the darkness as easily as a fiend.

Name: Fiendish Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You were raised by a tiefling or a fiendish relative, or you've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the fiendish realms.

Name: Fire Lung
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: A lifetime of proximity to flames has inured your lungs and eyes to smoke.

Name: First World Magic
Benefits: Your connection to the First World grants you a primal innate spell, much like those of the fey.

Name: Fleet
Benefits: Increase your Speed by 5 feet.

Name: Flexible Studies
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've collected a cross-section of information on various disciplines you can refer to when preparing for various tasks.

Name: Flying Blade
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've learned to apply your flashy techniques to thrown weapons as easily as melee attacks.

Name: Focused Fascination
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you use Fascinating Performance in a combat encounter, you need only a success, rather than a critical success, to fascinate your target.

Name: Folksy Patter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are adept at disguising coded messages as folksy idioms.

Name: Forager
Benefits: Forage for supplies to provide for multiple creatures.

Name: Forensic Acumen
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Rapidly examine a body and Recall Knowledge about it.

Name: Forge-Day's Rest
Benefits: Your unusual rest cycle allows you to recover faster.

Name: Forlorn
Benefits: Watching your friends age and die fills you with moroseness that protects you against harmful emotions.

Name: Form of the Fiend
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Part of your body has an obvious, fiendish appearance.

Name: Foxfire
Benefits: A crack of your tail sparks wisps of blue energy.

Name: Fumesoul
Benefits: The air inside you asserts itself as a toxic miasma, inuring you to most poisons.

Name: Ganzi Gaze
Benefits: You have unusual sensory abilities passed down from your chaotic forebears.

Name: Gemsoul
Benefits: The earth inside you asserts itself as crystallized gemstones or metals, like a cluster of quartz or veins of iron and gold.

Name: General Training
Benefits: Your adaptability manifests in your mastery of a range of useful abilities.

Name: Genie Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You've trained with weapons used by your genie ancestors.

Name: Ghost Hunter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your connection to the Boneyard ensures that your blows strike true against spectral beings.

Name: Glean Contents
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Decipher Writing even when you can’t see the document well.

Name: Glean Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You tap into the collected lore of the divine, accessing a variety of potentially useful information.

Name: Glider Form
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your eidolon evolves wings, a buoyant body, or some other means to control descent.

Name: Gloomseer
Benefits: Gloom holds few terrors for you, and the pall of darkness over Nidal has made you comfortable in dim light.

Name: Gnoll Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You paid attention to your senior hunters to learn their tricks.

Name: Gnoll Weapon Familiarity
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You were taught to be a hunter and a raider.

Name: Gnome Obsession
Benefits: You might have a flighty nature, but when a topic captures your attention, you dive into it headfirst.

Name: Gnome Polyglot
Benefits: Your extensive travels, curiosity, and love of learning help you to learn languages quickly.

Name: Gnome Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You favor unusual weapons tied to your people, such as blades with curved and peculiar shapes.

Name: Goading Feint
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you trick a foe, you can goad them into overextending their next attack.

Name: Goblin Lore
Benefits: You’ve picked up skills and tales from your goblin community.

Name: Goblin Scuttle
Benefits: You take advantage of your ally’s movement to adjust your position.

Name: Goblin Song
Benefits: You sing annoying goblin songs, distracting your foes with silly and repetitive lyrics.

Name: Goblin Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: Others might look upon them with disdain, but you know that the weapons of your people are as effective as they are sharp.

Name: Goloma Courage
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: The most important thing you've learned living with fear is how to overcome it.

Name: Goloma Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You lived an insulated life focused on avoiding danger.

Name: Gorilla Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You lower yourself to the ground and take an imposing, knuckle-walking stance.

Name: Grasping Reach
Benefits: You can extend a tangle of vines or tendrils to support your arms and extend your reach.

Name: Gravesight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can see in the darkness as easily as a psychopomp.

Name: Gravity Weapon
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your expertise with your weapons and commitment to taking out your targets lends you magical power.

Name: Grim Insight
Benefits: Others’ attempts to scare you often grant you insights about your would-be bullies that you can then exploit.

Name: Grimspawn
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your lineage traces back to a daemon, one of the manifestations of horrific forms of death that devour souls within their foul home of Abaddon.

Name: Grippli Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You are well versed in grippli culture and tactics.

Name: Grippli Weapon Familiarity
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You've trained with weapons ideally suited to marshes and dense forests.

Name: Group Coercion
Benefits: Coerce multiple targets simultaneously.

Name: Group Impression
Benefits: Make an Impression on multiple targets at once.

Name: Hag Claws
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you came of age, your fingernails grew long and sharp.

Name: Hag's Sight
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've nurtured the supernatural abilities gifted by your hag mother, particularly your sight.

Name: Halfling Lore
Benefits: You’ve dutifully learned important skills passed down through generations of halfling tradition.

Name: Halfling Luck
Benefits: Your happy-go-lucky nature makes it seem like misfortune avoids you.

Name: Halfling Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You favor traditional halfling weapons, so you’ve learned how to use them more effectively.

Name: Halo
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are surrounded by a halo of light and goodness at all times.

Name: Hand of the Apprentice
Benefits: You can magically hurl your weapon at your foe.

Name: Handy with Your Paws
Benefits: You can easily craft objects.

Name: Hard Tail
Benefits: Your tail is much stronger than most, and you can lash out with it with the strength of a whip.

Name: Hard to Fool
Benefits: You're accustomed to seeing through shifting darkness and bewildering magic.

Name: Harming Hands
Benefits: The mordant power of your negative energy grows.

Name: Harmlessly Cute
Benefits: Your size and demeanor make it easy for you to convince others that you mean no harm.

Name: Haughty Obstinacy
Benefits: Your powerful ego makes it harder for others to order you around.

Name: Heal Companion
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a deep devotion to your animal companion that enables you to magically heal their wounds.

Name: Healing Hands
Benefits: Your positive energy is even more vibrant and restorative.

Name: Hefty Hauler
Benefits: Increase your Bulk limits by 2.

Name: Hellspawn
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your lineage descends from devils, the conniving schemers of Hell's malevolent hierarchy.

Name: Hobgoblin Lore
Benefits: You’ve studied traditional hobgoblin exercises and fieldcraft, all of which have a militaristic bent.

Name: Hobgoblin Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You are trained with composite longbows, composite shortbows, glaives, longbows, longswords, and shortbows.

Name: Hobnobber
Benefits: Gather Information rapidly.

Name: Holy Castigation
Benefits: You combine holy energy with positive energy to damage demons, devils, and their evil ilk.

Name: Hunted Shot
Benefits: You take two quick shots against the one you hunt.

Name: Hunter's Defense
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your canny understanding of natural and primal creatures helps you predict and dodge their attacks.

Name: Hydraulic Deflection
Benefits: Drawing moisture from the atmosphere, you create a disc of hovering water that deflects attacks.

Name: Hyena Familiar
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Hyenas serve gnolls as pets, trackers, and in your case, vessels for spirits.

Name: Hymn of Healing
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learn the hymn of healing composition spell (page 228), which imbues your music with rich melodies that help your allies recover from harm.

Name: Idyllkin
Benefits: Your wild, unique features betray your agathion birthright.

Name: Illusion Sense
Benefits: Your ancestors spent their days cloaked and cradled in illusions, and as a result, sensing illusion magic is second nature to you.

Name: Impressive Performance
Benefits: Make an Impression with Performance.

Name: Improvisational Defender
Benefits: You are always prepared for fights that frequently disrupt seemingly peaceful times.

Name: Improvise Tool
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Craft basic tools without a basic crafter’s book.

Name: Incredible Initiative
Benefits: +2 to initiative rolls.

Name: Inner Fire
Benefits: You can call the fire inside you into the palm of your hand.

Name: Innocuous
Benefits: Halflings have been unobtrusive assistants of larger folk for untold ages, and your people count on this assumption of innocence.

Name: Inoculation
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Grant patients +2 to saves against getting a disease again.

Name: Internal Cohesion
Benefits: Axis's order suffuses your body and helps it maintain coherency.

Name: Internal Compartment
Benefits: You can hide a small object of up to light Bulk inside a hollow cavity on one of your forearms.

Name: Intimidating Glare
Benefits: Demoralize a creature without speaking.

Name: Intuitive Cooperation
Benefits: You are accustomed to working alongside others, relying on each other to get by.

Name: Intuitive Crafting
Benefits: Your affinity with process and order makes you a natural artisan.

Name: Inventive Offensive
Benefits: You can jury-rig your weapons to perform in unexpected ways.

Name: Iron Fists
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your fists have been forged by battle, your naturally tough skin and dense bone further hardened by conflict.

Name: Iron Repercussions
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Disobeying your Iron Command has lasting consequences.

Name: Irrepressible (Ganzi)
Benefits: Your contrary nature means you bounce back with prejudice.

Name: Jungle Strider
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You are adept at dodging roots, foliage, and other jungle obstacles.

Name: Junk Tinker
Benefits: You can make useful tools out of even twisted or rusted scraps.

Name: Keep Up Appearances
Benefits: Taldan pride means you never show weakness.

Name: Ki Rush
Benefits: You can use ki to move with extraordinary speed and make yourself harder to hit.

Name: Ki Strike
Benefits: Your study of the flow of mystical energy allows you to harness it into your physical strikes.

Name: Kitsune Lore
Benefits: You excel at navigating social situations and keeping secrets.

Name: Kitsune Spell Familiarity
Benefits: You've picked up a few magical tricks.

Name: Know Oneself
Benefits: You center yourself and call to mind the Vudrani monastic ideals of mindfulness and self-knowledge.

Name: Know Your Own
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've spent countless hours studying the history of elves on your world and beyond and are a studied expert in your people's ways.

Name: Known Weaknesses
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Whenever you Devise a Stratagem, you can also attempt a check to Recall Knowledge as part of that action.

Name: Kobold Breath
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You channel your draconic exemplar's power into a gout of energy.

Name: Kobold Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You attentively learned key kobold survival strategies and mythology from your elders.

Name: Kobold Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: You've trained with weapons ideal for subterranean efficiency.

Name: Lavasoul
Benefits: Your elemental lineage manifests as magma and molten rock, and you can focus the magma into your hand to attack your foes.

Name: Lawbringer
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You trace your lineage to archons: embodiments of heavenly virtues, guardians of the seven-tiered mountain of Heaven, and nurturers of law and virtue within mortals.

Name: Leech-Clipper
Benefits: You are trained to capture deserters, or “leeches”.

Name: Lemma of Vision
Benefits: You've solved a tiny stepping stone in your self-discovery, awakening new depths in your sight.

Name: Lengthy Diversion
Benefits: Remain hidden after you Create a Diversion.

Name: Leshy Familiar
Benefits: You gain a leshy familiar, a tiny plant that embodies one of the many spirits of nature.

Name: Leshy Lore
Benefits: You deeply understand your people’s cultural traditions and innate strengths.

Name: Leshy Superstition
Benefits: You notice spirits that inhabit objects, learning which bring good fortune and which are unlucky.

Name: Lie to Me
Benefits: Use Deception to detect lies.

Name: Life-Giving Magic
Benefits: The upwelling of innate magic refreshes your body.

Name: Lightning Tongue
Benefits: Your tongue darts out faster than the eye can see to retrieve loose objects.

Name: Lingering Composition
Benefits: By adding a flourish, you make your compositions last longer.

Name: Living Weapon
Benefits: You've learned to use part of your form as a weapon.

Name: Lizardfolk Lore
Benefits: You listened carefully to the tales passed down among your community.

Name: Magus's Analysis
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You make an assessment informed by your knowledge of how a creature fights.

Name: Maiden's Mending
Benefits: You can tap into some of the magic that flows through your blood to give you new life.

Name: Mariner's Fire
Benefits: You conjure uncanny orbs of spiritual flame that float above or below the water's surface.

Name: Marsh Runner
Benefits: You are adept at moving through marshy terrain.

Name: Martial Performance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your muse has taught you how to handle a wider variety of weapons than most bards, empowering you to effortlessly blend your performance into combat even with the most inelegant tools.

Name: Medical Researcher
Benefits: Kassi has taught you not only how to apply medicines with your medical skills but how to craft them as well.

Name: Meld into Eidolon
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: Your physical form can combine with that of your eidolon, granting benefits but limiting your capabilities.

Name: Miresoul
Benefits: You have a connection to the muddier denizens of the Plane of Earth from its border with the Plane of Water, and your elemental lineage manifests as clay or mud, reflecting that bond.

Name: Mistsoul
Benefits: You have a connection to vaporous forms of water, such as fog and mist.

Name: Moment of Clarity
Benefits: You push back your rage for a moment in order to think clearly.

Name: Monastic Archer Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enter a specialized stance for a unique martial art centered around the use of a bow.

Name: Monastic Weaponry
Benefits: You have trained with the traditional weaponry of your monastery or school.

Name: Monster Hunter
Benefits: You swiftly assess your prey and apply what you know.

Name: Monstrous Peacemaker
Benefits: Your dual human and orc nature has given you a unique perspective.

Name: Moon May
Benefits: Your mother was a moon hag, a handmaiden of Groetus, and you have a single scarlet eye and a sliver of her supernal foresight.

Name: Mountain Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of an implacable mountain allowing you to strike with the weight of an avalanche.

Name: Multilingual
Benefits: Learn two new languages.

Name: Musetouched
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your blood sings with the liberating power of the azatas, living embodiments of freedom from the wild realm of Elysium.

Name: Nanite Surge
Benefits: You stimulate your nanites, forcing your body to temporarily increase its efficiency.

Name: Natural Ambition
Benefits: You were raised to be ambitious and always reach for the stars, leading you to progress quickly in your chosen field.

Name: Natural Medicine
Benefits: Use Nature to Treat Wounds.

Name: Natural Performer
Benefits: Entertainment comes naturally to you.

Name: Natural Skill
Benefits: Your ingenuity allows you to learn a wide variety of skills.

Name: Nestling Fall
Benefits: You trust the strength of your wings and can spread them to glide safely to the ground.

Name: Nightvision Adaptation
Benefits: The nanites in your ocular processors have adapted to darkness, enhancing your ability to see in the dark.

Name: Nimble Dodge
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You deftly dodge out of the way.

Name: Nimble Elf
Benefits: Your muscles are tightly honed.

Name: Nimble Hooves
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your legs end in hooves rather than feet, with joints and tendons that allow you to move with great haste.

Name: No Cause for Alarm
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Reduce creatures’ frightened condition values.

Name: Nocturnal Charm
Benefits: The supernatural charm of your vampiric progenitor hangs about you, and you've learned to use it on mortals.

Name: Nocturnal Grippli
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You tend to do most of your hunting and work at night and have adapted to the requirements of nocturnal life.

Name: Nosoi's Mask
Benefits: Many psychopomps wear masks when dealing with the living, and many cultures believe that seeing an unmasked psychopomp's face invites death.

Name: Oddity Identification
Benefits: +2 to Occultism checks to Identify Magic with certain traits.

Name: Old Soul
Benefits: Your immortal lineage has granted you a lifespan much longer than most mortals, and you've learned a lot along the way.

Name: One for All
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: With precisely the right words of encouragement, you bolster an ally's efforts.

Name: Ongoing Selfishness
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your powerful personality and incredible ego demand that you protect yourself above all else.

Name: Orc Ferocity
Benefits: Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries.

Name: Orc Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: The hold elders taught you your people's histories, told tales of great athletic feats, and shared with you the hardships your ancestors endured so that you can pass this wisdom down to future generations.

Name: Orc Sight
Benefits: Your orc blood is strong enough to grant you the keen vision of your orc forebears.

Name: Orc Superstition
Benefits: You defend yourself against magic by relying on techniques derived from orc cultural superstitions.

Name: Orc Warmask
Benefits: You paint your face to create a warmask.

Name: Orc Weapon Familiarity
Benefits: In combat, you favor the brutal weapons that are traditional for your orc ancestors.

Name: Otherworldly Magic
Benefits: Your elven magic manifests as a simple arcane spell, even if you aren’t formally trained in magic.

Name: Overextending Feint
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you trick a foe, instead of catching them off guard, you goad them into overextending their next attack.

Name: Overlooked Mastermind
Benefits: Many consider half-orcs little more than dumb brutes.

Name: Pack Hunter
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You were taught how to hunt as part of a pack.

Name: Pack Rat
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Years of packing for travel have taught you how to cram vast quantities into small spaces.

Name: Parthenogenic Hatchling
Benefits: You were hatched from an unfertilized egg during hard times for your people, and you are a biological copy of your mother.

Name: Pelagic Aptitude
Benefits: You've learned special tricks to survive underwater.

Name: Perfect Dive
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: You dive into the water with exceptional skill and connection to the waves, urging the water itself to cushion your fall.

Name: Pickpocket
Benefits: Steal or Palm an Object more effectively.

Name: Pierce the Darkness
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your eyes have adapted to see in all circumstances, even without the assistance of light.

Name: Pilgrim's Token
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: A religious token lets you act ﬁrst on a tie for initiative.

Name: Pitborn
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your blood bears the mark of a demon, a living embodiment of sin from the fetid depths of the Abyss.

Name: Plant Evidence
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can put a single item you're holding of light or negligible Bulk onto a person without them noticing.

Name: Plumekith
Benefits: Your blood soars with the power of the magnificent garuda, proud and stoic avian warriors.

Name: Point-Blank Shot
Benefits: You take aim to pick off nearby enemies quickly.

Name: Power Attack
Benefits: You unleash a particularly powerful attack that clobbers your foe but leaves you a bit unsteady.

Name: Prairie Rider
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You grew up riding your clan's shaggy ponies and riding dogs.

Name: Premonition of Avoidance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your deity grants you limited foresight, warning you of dangers an instant before they occur.

Name: Proximity Alert
Benefits: You're unnaturally in tune with your surroundings and react instinctively to danger.

Name: Quah Bond
Benefits: You grew up among the Shoanti tribes, with the spirits watching over you, and they offer you guidance.

Name: Quick Bomber
Benefits: You keep your bombs in easy-to-reach pouches from which you draw without thinking.

Name: Quick Coercion
Benefits: Coerce a creature quickly.

Name: Quick Identification
Prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Identify Magic in 1 minute or less.

Name: Quick Jump
Benefits: High Jump or Long Jump as a single action.

Name: Quick Repair
Benefits: Repair items quickly.

Name: Quick Shape
Benefits: Your instincts kick in and you take on an aggressive stance.

Name: Quick Squeeze
Benefits: Move swiftly as you Squeeze.

Name: Radiant Circuitry
Benefits: Your biological circuitry emits light like a torch, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet).

Name: Raging Intimidation
Benefits: Your fury fills your foes with fear.

Name: Raging Thrower
Benefits: Thrown weapons become especially deadly in your fury. You apply the additional damage from Rage to your thrown weapon attacks. If you have the Brutal Critical feat or the devastator class feature, apply their benefits to thrown weapon attacks.

Name: Rain of Embers Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of an enraged phoenix, holding your fingers as rigid as deadly talons while moving with quick, flickering gestures that dance with biting flames.

Name: Raise a Tome
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You raise up the book you're holding and flip it open to defend yourself and expedite your studies.

Name: Ranged Reprisal
Benefits: You can use Retributive Strike with a ranged weapon.

Name: Rat Familiar
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have a pet rat that has become magically bonded to you.

Name: Ratfolk Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Years of experience among ratfolk communities have made you nimble, and you've learned to run and hide when enemies threaten.

Name: Ratspeak
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: To you, the squeaking of rats and other rodents makes a strange kind of sense.

Name: Ravening's Desperation
Prerequisites: trained in Zevgavizeb Lore
Benefits: Your study of the Beast of Gluttondark has taught you how to make do in the most trying of circumstances rather than succumb to weakness.

Name: Razor Claws
Benefits: Your have honed your claws to be deadly.

Name: Razzle-Dazzle
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've spent considerable time practicing the manipulation of light, weaponizing your blade's reflection or bolstering the luminosity of magical displays to unconventional heights.

Name: Reach Spell
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Traits: Bard, Cleric, Concentrate, Druid, Metamagic, Oracle, Sorcerer, Witch, Wizard
Benefits: You can extend your spells’ range.

Name: Reactive Shield
Benefits: You can snap your shield into place just as you would take a blow, avoiding the hit at the last second.

Name: Read Lips
Benefits: Read the lips of people you can see.

Name: Reassuring Presence
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You serve as an anchor to your close companions, calming them in times of stress.

Name: Recognize Spell
Prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Identify a spell as a reaction as it's being cast.

Name: Reflective Ripple Stance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You enter a stance of fluid grace as small amounts of water flow with your movements and attacks.

Name: Remorseless Lash
Benefits: You’re skilled at beating a foe when their morale is already breaking.

Name: Reptile Rider
Benefits: To you, crocodilians, giant lizards, and dinosaurs are loyal steeds, not monsters.

Name: Reptile Speaker
Benefits: You hear the sounds of reptiles as language.

Name: Retractable Claws
Benefits: You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals 1d4 slashing damage.

Name: Reveal True Name
Source: Secrets of Magic
Traits: Auditory, Concentrate, Emotion, General, Mental, Skill, True Name
Prerequisites: trained in trained in Intimidation and at least one of Arcana, Nature, Occult, and Religion
Benefits: You attempt to get a creature to do as you wish by threatening them with your knowledge of their true name.

Name: Ride
Benefits: Automatically succeed at commanding your mount to move.

Name: Riftmarked
Benefits: Long ago, qlippoth marked someone in your lineage, most likely through their ancient runestones that dot Golarion's surface.

Name: Rimesoul
Benefits: The water inside you is cold and frozen, like sheets of ice and frigid glaciers.

Name: Risky Surgery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Deal damage to a patient to gain +2 to Treat Wounds.

Name: Rock Runner
Benefits: Your innate connection to stone makes you adept at moving across uneven surfaces.

Name: Root Magic
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Create a token that grants a bonus against a spell or haunt.

Name: Rough Rider
Benefits: You are especially good at riding traditional goblin mounts.

Name: Round Ears
Benefits: Your elven lineage is subtle enough that you look barely different from other humans, and you’ve learned to use that to your advantage.

Name: Ru-Shi
Benefits: You were born to a jiang-shi, one of the so-called hopping vampires found most often in Tian-Xia.

Name: Saberteeth
Benefits: You have long fangs, natural or augmented.

Name: Saoc Astrology
Benefits: The ancient Saoc Brethren were the masters of astrology, and while your knowledge may be but a pale shadow of their wisdom, it still comes in handy.

Name: Scamper
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You instinctively know how to flee danger.

Name: Scamper Underfoot
Benefits: You are used to ducking under foes and can scurry around the battlefield with ease.

Name: Scavenger's Search
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're always on the lookout for supplies and valuables.

Name: Scholar's Inheritance
Benefits: Your parents devoted themselves to alchemical experiments involving elemental energy.

Name: Schooled in Secrets
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Gather Information about secret societies and mystery cults.

Name: Seasoned
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Prerequisites: trained in Alcohol Lore, Cooking Lore, or Crafting
Benefits: +1 to Craft food and drink, including potions.

Name: Secret Speech
Benefits: Learn the secret language of a society.

Name: Seedpod
Benefits: Your body produces a nearly endless supply of hard seedpods.

Name: Sensitive Nose
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Your large black nose isn't just for show.

Name: Shackleborn
Benefits: Your lineage shows the signs of velstrac tampering, including some curious quirk bequeathed by those shadowy surgeons of flesh and souls.

Name: Shadow Blending
Benefits: You draw shadows close to create a shroud.

Name: Shadow of the Wilds
Benefits: It’s difficult to notice your passage through wild areas.

Name: Shapechanger's Intuition
Benefits: A lifetime of experience helps you see through disguises.

Name: Share Thoughts
Prerequisites: Mualijae ethnicity, Ilverani ethnicity, or Vourinoi ethnicity
Benefits: You have an uncanny knack of communicating with other elves without speaking, though this habit that is often uncomfortable to observers.

Name: Sharp Fangs
Benefits: Your teeth are formidable weapons.

Name: Shield Block
Benefits: Ward off a blow with your shield.

Name: Shisk Lore
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You hoard knowledge like a dragon hoards gold.

Name: Shoony Lore
Benefits: Growing up in shoony society, you learned the value of honesty, friendship, and hard work, even during trying times.

Name: Shore Step
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: The shallows and tide pools have always called to you and let you pass unhindered.

Name: Shrouded Magic
Benefits: Choose one cantrip from the occult spell list.

Name: Shrouded Mien
Benefits: You're used to dealing with dangerous situations and sinister creatures.

Name: Sign Language
Benefits: Learn sign languages.

Name: Sinister Appearance
Benefits: You possess horns, a tail, or red eyes, or could otherwise be mistaken for a tiefling.

Name: Skill Training
Benefits: Become trained in a skill.

Name: Skittertalk
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with spiders and other arachnids.

Name: Skull Creeper
Benefits: You wear skulls to demoralize foes.

Name: Slag May
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your mother was an annis hag, known for physical prowess, and you have one violet or steel-gray eye.

Name: Slink
Benefits: You can move through gloom with the speed of darkness.

Name: Slither
Benefits: You are an expert at moving through extremely tight spaces.

Name: Smashing Tail
Benefits: You have a tail that serves as a potent weapon.

Name: Smokesoul
Benefits: You have a connection to smoke and haze.

Name: Snagging Strike
Benefits: You combine an attack with quick grappling moves to throw an enemy off balance as long as it stays in your reach.

Name: Snare Crafting
Benefits: Craft snares.

Name: Snare Setter
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are adept at the time-honored kobold art of trap making.

Name: Sneaky
Benefits: Stealth is an important tool in your arsenal.

Name: Snow May
Benefits: You're the child of a winter hag, with one blue-white eye and an affinity for rime and snow.

Name: Sociable
Benefits: You’re extremely extroverted, and you often spend your time carousing or otherwise socializing.

Name: Speak with Bats
Benefits: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with bats.

Name: Specialty Crafting
Benefits: Gain bonuses to Craft certain items.

Name: Spellbook Prodigy
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are particularly adept at learning spells to add to your spellbook.

Name: Spelunker
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: Living underground, you have learned to find your way without landmarks or even solid ground.

Name: Spine Stabber
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: The quills on your arms are particularly sharp and sturdy.

Name: Splinter Faith
Benefits: Your faith in your deity is represented in an extremely unusual way that some might call heretical

Name: Sprite's Spark
Benefits: You can fling a portion of your magic at foes.

Name: Squawk!
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You let out an awkward squawk, ruffle your feathers, or fake some other birdlike tic to cover up a social misstep or faux pas.

Name: Star Orb
Benefits: Your magic has crystallized into a spherical stone.

Name: Startling Appearance (Fleshwarp)
Benefits: Your appearance is enough to frighten without words.

Name: Steady Balance
Benefits: Maintain your balance in adverse conditions.

Name: Steady on Stone
Benefits: Your connection to the earth makes natural uneven surfaces less of a hindrance for you.

Name: Steadying Stone
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: The earth has taught you how to remain unyielding and firm.

Name: Stoked Flame Stance
Source: Secrets of Magic
Benefits: You enter a stance of fast, fiery movements.

Name: Stone Face
Benefits: Through conditioning or experience, you've mastered the art of composure, even in the face of fear.

Name: Stonecunning
Benefits: You have a knack for noticing even small inconsistencies and craftsmanship techniques in the stonework around you.

Name: Storm Born
Benefits: You are at home out in the elements, reveling in the power of nature unleashed.

Name: Storm's Lash
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Wind and lightning have always been close friends to you.

Name: Stormsoul
Benefits: Your elemental ancestor's influence manifests in you as tumultuous, thundering storms, with dark clouds and bolts of lightning.

Name: Story Crooner
Benefits: You're a talented story weaver and use your voice effectively.

Name: Straveika
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You descend from one of the truly ancient vampires, a nosferatu cursed to eternal life but not eternal youth.

Name: Streetwise
Benefits: Use Society to Gather Information and Recall Knowledge.

Name: Striking Retribution
Benefits: You have an appropriately intense hatred for alghollthus.

Name: Strix Defender
Benefits: Your ancestral feud with humans gives you experience dealing with vicious foes, and your vengeance knows no bounds.

Name: Strix Lore
Benefits: You're well connected to your tribe and perhaps even strix communities beyond your own, where you've learned about the land and techniques of graceful movement.

Name: Student of the Canon
Benefits: More accurately recognize the tenets of your faith or philosophy.

Name: Studious Magic
Source: The Mwangi Expanse
Benefits: You've taken an interest in anadi arcane traditions.

Name: Stumbling Stance
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You enter a seemingly unfocused stance that mimics the movements of the inebriated—bobbing, weaving, leaving false openings, and distracting your enemies from your true movements.

Name: Subtle Delivery
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You can capably deliver toxins with a blowgun.

Name: Subtle Theft
Benefits: Your thefts are harder to notice.

Name: Sudden Charge
Benefits: With a quick sprint, you dash up to your foe and swing.

Name: Suli-Jann
Benefits: Your elemental ancestor was a janni, genies that walk the mortal world and embody all four elements together.

Name: Sure Feet
Benefits: Whether keeping your balance or scrambling up a tricky climb, your hairy, calloused feet easily find purchase.

Name: Surface Culture
Benefits: Your interactions with other cultures on the surface have not only taught you about many other ancestries, but have also helped you realize the value of your own.

Name: Surface Skimmer
Source: Azarketi Ancestry Web Supplement
Benefits: By sinking gently beneath the waves, you obscure your presence and utilize the water as a barrier between you and land combatants.

Name: Survey Wildlife
Benefits: Identify nearby creatures through signs and clues.

Name: Svetocher
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You were born to one of the moroi, the most common vampires, and you share their supernatural fortitude and power of persuasion.

Name: Swift
Benefits: You move with the wind always at your back.

Name: Syncretism
Benefits: You have come to see the overlap between two deities’ teachings

Name: Tail Whip
Benefits: By birth or through training, your tail is strong enough to make for a powerful melee weapon.

Name: Takedown Expert
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've mastered combat practices that let you get up close and bring down perpetrators alive.

Name: Tengu Lore
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You learned skills for surviving in the place where your people were dispersed.

Name: Tengu Weapon Familiarity
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You've trained with a blade and other tengu weapons ever since you hatched.

Name: Terrain Expertise
Benefits: +1 to Survival checks in certain terrain.

Name: Terrain Stalker
Benefits: Sneak in certain terrain without attempting a check.

Name: That's Odd
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: When you enter a new location, such as a room or corridor, you immediately notice one thing out of the ordinary.

Name: Theoretical Acumen
Benefits: You study a creature’s form and behavior to hypothesize likely means of overcoming its strengths.

Name: Tide-Hardened
Benefits: You're at home in the unpredictable tides.

Name: Tiger Stance
Benefits: You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks.

Name: Tinkering Fingers
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You're good with your hands and can quickly improvise a fix for broken or damaged equipment.

Name: Titan Slinger
Benefits: You have learned how to use your sling to fell enormous creatures.

Name: Titan Wrestler
Benefits: Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip larger creatures.

Name: Toughness
Benefits: Increase your maximum HP and reduce the DCs of recovery checks.

Name: Train Animal
Benefits: Teach an animal a trick.

Name: Trap Finder
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to the dangers and presence of traps.

Name: Trick Magic Item
Prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
Benefits: Activate a magic item you normally can't activate.

Name: Tumble Behind (Rogue)
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You tumble under and behind your foe to catch them off guard.

Name: Tupilaq Carver
Prerequisites: You have a spellcasting class feature with the divine or primal tradition
Benefits: You know the truth behind old stories that tell of sending a fetish of bone and sinew to seek vengeance.

Name: Tusks
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You have particularly long, jagged tusks perfect for tearing meat from bone.

Name: Twin Feint
Benefits: You make a dazzling series of attacks with both weapons, using the first attack to throw your foe of guard against a second attack at a different angle.

Name: Twin Takedown
Benefits: You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons.

Name: Twitchy
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: You are naturally suspicious and wary of danger, especially when you suspect someone might be leading you into an ambush.

Name: Unassuming Dedication
Benefits: Your family instilled the values of care and patience into you from a young age.

Name: Unburdened Iron
Benefits: You’ve learned techniques first devised by your ancestors during their ancient wars, allowing you to comfortably wear massive suits of armor.

Name: Uncanny Agility
Benefits: You have near-supernatural poise that lets you move swiftly across the most unsteady surfaces.

Name: Unconventional Weaponry
Benefits: You’ve familiarized yourself with a particular weapon, potentially from another ancestry or culture.

Name: Undaunted
Benefits: Your spirit has endured many challenges over its long existence, and you are certain you can overcome whatever hardships life throws your way.

Name: Underwater Marauder
Benefits: Fight more effectively underwater.

Name: Underworld Investigator
Source: Advanced Player's Guide
Benefits: Your work as an investigator makes you familiar with the criminal element.
